PreparerPersonGrp.PreparerPersonNm: JUSTIN R SHAW CPA CFE CGMA

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER IS TO PROTECT CHILDREN, STRENGTHEN FAMILIES AND PREVENT CHILD ABUSE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER IS TO PROTECT CHILDREN, STRENGTHEN FAMILIES AND PREVENT CHILD ABUSE.
IRS990.Desc: FISCAL YEAR 2017 - 2018 WAS AGAIN A YEAR FILLED WITH AMAZING WORK DONE BY DEDICATED AND PASSIONATE EMPLOYEES. WE SAW WONDERFUL COMMITMENT FROM STAFF, CLIENTS AND VOLUNTEERS IN WORKING TOWARD OUR MISSION OF PROTECTING CHILDREN, STRENGTHENING FAMILIES AND PREVENTING CHILD ABUSE. WE ARE THRILLED TO SHARE THE FOLLOWING ACCOMPLISHMENTS: IN FISCAL YEAR 17-18 FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER SERVED 2,556 INDIVIDUALS WITH 51,011 HOURS OF DIRECT CARE. THIS WAS ACCOMPLISHED BY 55 EMPLOYEES, BOTH FULL AND PART-TIME. THE AGENCY ALSO HAD THE SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE OF 12,743 VOLUNTEER HOURS OF SERVICE GIVEN BY 1,068 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER IS PLEASED TO REPORT THAT 87 OF EVERY DOLLAR RAISED GOES DIRECTLY TO PROGRAM SUPPORT. WE CONTINUED TO SEE WONDERFUL VOLUNTEER PROJECTS IN 2017 - 2018. WINDERMERE COMMERCIAL REAL ESTATE RETURNED AND BROUGHT OVER 130 VOLUNTEERS WHO WORKED OVER 735 HOURS OF SERVICE. THEIR GROUP TRANSFORMED LIFESTART VILLAGE AND GAVE THE PROPERTY A MUCH NEEDED MAKEOVER IN PREPARATION OF OUR 15 YEAR CELEBRATION. THEY DONATED OVER 6,000 IN MATERIALS MAKING THEIR TOTAL CONTRIBUTION TO THE AGENCY 21,000. CRISIS NURSERIES: 24/7 FREE SHORT-TERM CHILDCARE FOR FAMILIES IN CRISIS SITUATIONS AND CHILDREN AT-RISK OF ABUSE OR NEGLECT. 1,319 CHILDREN MADE 9,329 VISITS TO THE CRISIS NURSERY, INCLUDING 911 OVERNIGHT STAYS, 9,124 MEALS, AND OVER 52,670 HOURS OF CARE. THESE SERVICE TOTALS ALSO INCLUDE 138 FAMILIES EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, WHO WERE PROVIDED WITH BOTH DAYTIME AND OVERNIGHT VISITS. THE CRISIS NURSERIES PROVIDED A SAFE REFUGE FOR 71 CHILDREN AT RISK FOR ABUSE OR NEGLECT AND 61 CHILDREN WHOSE FAMILIES WERE INVOLVED IN DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SITUATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COUNSELING SERVICES: PROFESSIONAL THERAPY FOR CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND INDIVIDUALS. 375 CLIENTS RECEIVED OVER 3,226 HOURS OF THERAPY. 201 INDIVIDUALS ATTENDED EDUCATIONAL CLASSES TAUGHT BY CLINICAL STAFF FOR A COMBINED TOTAL OF 725 STAFF HOURS. 48 SESSIONS OF SUPPORT GROUPS RAN FOR 72 HOURS. WE CONTINUE TO SEE IMPRESSIVE OUTCOMES WHERE 90% OF CLIENTS IN THE CLINICAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT REPORTED AN INCREASE IN QUALITY OF LIFE AFTER USING FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: LIFESTART VILLAGE: HOUSING AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS SINGLE PARENTS AND THEIR CHILDREN. 229 INDIVIDUALS WERE SERVED ACROSS ALL THREE PHASES OF THE PROGRAM. OVER 405 HOURS OF CASE MANAGEMENT AND 293.50 HOURS OF COUNSELING WERE PROVIDED. 92% OF SINGLE PARENTS LIVING IN PHASE I INCREASED THEIR SELF-SUFFICIENCY SCORE DURING THE YEAR AND 100% INCREASED THEIR EARNED INCOME WHILE LIVING THERE. CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O LIFESTART VILLAGE: THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF LIFESTART VILLAGE IS TO MOVE SINGLE PARENTS WITH CHILDREN FROM DEPENDENCY TO SELF-SUFFICIENCY. DURING 2018, 12 FAMILIES LEFT LIFESTART VILLAGE: 10 (83%) MOVED INTO STABLE, PERMANENT HOUSING. LIFESTART VILLAGE GOALS/OUTCOMES: PROVIDE HOUSING FOR HOMELESS OR NEAR HOMELESS SINGLE-PARENT FAMILIES. 67 FAMILIES SERVED (2018) COMPLETION OF 3 EDUCATION CLASSES: PARENTING, LIFE SKILLS, AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT. THIS REQUIREMENT IS MANDATORY FOR ALL PHASE 1 RESIDENTS. 81% OF PARENTS REQUIRED TO ATTEND, GRADUATED FROM THE COURSE (2018) SUPPORT PARENTS WITHOUT A HIGH-SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR GED TO OBTAIN ONE. 6 SINGLE PARENTS RECEIVED THEIR GED WHILE IN LSV'S PHASE 1 HOUSING (MAY- DEC. 2018) 3 ENROLLED IN A VOCATIONAL PROGRAM OR COLLEGE (MAY-DEC. 2018) SUPPORT EFFORTS TO GAIN EMPLOYMENT THAT WILL SUSTAIN RENT AND UTILITIES FOR THE FAMILY. 33 PARENTS FROM PHASE 1 AND 2 RECEIVED NEW JOBS (MAY-DEC. 2018) 67 PARENTS FROM PHASE 1 AND 2 RECEIVED AN INCREASE IN EARNED INCOME (2018)

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ADOPTION RESPITE CARE: IN-HOME RESPITE CARE FOR ADOPTIVE FAMILIES. 118 CHILDREN IN 34 FAMILIES WERE SERVED IN 192 VISITS TOTALING OVER 1,115 HOURS OF CARE. IN-HOME PARENTING PROGRAMS: FREE IN-HOME PARENTING SUPPORT. THE FAMILY MENTOR PROGRAM SERVED 206 INDIVIDUALS IN 58 FAMILIES WITH IN-HOME SUPPORT. THE PEER PARENTING PROGRAM SERVED 390 INDIVIDUALS IN 114 FAMILIES WITH IN- HOME SUPPORT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CENTER IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND THEREFORE HAS MADE NO PROVISION FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAXES IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE CENTER HAS BEEN DETERMINED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE NOT TO BE A "PRIVATE FOUNDATION" WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THERE WAS NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018. THE ORGANIZATION'S FORMS 990 FOR THE YEARS ENDING JUNE 30, 2018, 2017, 2016, AND 2015 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED. GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES REQUIRE TAX EFFECTS FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ONLY IF THE POSITION IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED IF THE POSITION WERE TO BE CHALLENGED BY A TAXING AUTHORITY. THE ASSESSMENT OF THE TAX POSITION IS BASED SOLELY ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION, WITHOUT REGARD TO THE LIKELIHOOD THAT THE TAX POSITION MAY BE CHALLENGED. IF AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION MEETS THE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THRESHOLD, THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY TO BE RECOGNIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT WITH THE TAXING AUTHORITY IS RECORDED. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS REFLECTED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX FILINGS AND DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS EXIST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE A TOTAL OF 525 DONATIONS OF IN-KIND ITEMS.

ADOPTION RESPITE CARE: IN-HOME RESPITE CARE FOR ADOPTIVE FAMILIES. 118 CHILDREN IN 34 FAMILIES WERE SERVED IN 192 VISITS TOTALING OVER 1,115 HOURS OF CARE. IN-HOME PARENTING PROGRAMS: FREE IN-HOME PARENTING SUPPORT. THE FAMILY MENTOR PROGRAM SERVED 206 INDIVIDUALS IN 58 FAMILIES WITH IN-HOME SUPPORT. THE PEER PARENTING PROGRAM SERVED 390 INDIVIDUALS IN 114 FAMILIES WITH IN- HOME SUPPORT.
A DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING. BOARD MEMBERS MAY ASK QUESTIONS OR MAKE ANY CHANGES PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN.

ANNUALLY, ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE SENT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM TO BE RETURNED TO THE AGENCY WHERE IT IS THEN FILED AT THE FAMILY SUPPORT CENTER IN THE BOARD MEMBER FILES. IT REQUIRES ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO BE DISCLOSED AND RECUSAL FROM DECISIONS RELATED TO ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

PRIOR TO THE BEGINNING OF A FISCAL YEAR, THE BOARD IS PRESENTED WITH A DETAILED PROPOSED BUDGET FOR THEIR APPROVAL. THE BUDGET INCLUDES ALL COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES FOR THE UPCOMING FISCAL YEAR. THE BOARD EVALUATES COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS WHEN EVALUATING COMPENSATION LEVELS.

PRIOR TO THE BEGINNING OF A FISCAL YEAR, THE BOARD IS PRESENTED WITH A DETAILED PROPOSED BUDGET FOR THEIR APPROVAL. THE BUDGET INCLUDES ALL COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES FOR THE UPCOMING FISCAL YEAR. THE BOARD EVALUATES COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS WHEN EVALUATING COMPENSATION LEVELS.

ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, AND OTHER POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE PUBLIC AT THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES OF THE AGENCY AT 1760 WEST 4805 SOUTH TAYLORSVILLE, UTAH 84118.
